sentence: [You don't remember how you made your way to this forest, but you feel like you belong there.]
[Mybe you should never leave...]

author: unknow
sentence: GRRRR...

author: wolf
sentence: GRRRY. WOLF KNEW HE SMELLED SOMETHING TASTY.

author: wolf
sentence: ARE YOU GOING TO RUN? PLEASE SAY YES.

author: wolf
sentence: WOLF LOVES A GOOD CHASE. WOLF LOVES IT VERY MUCH.
responses: There ghost wolfie. Nice ghost wolfie.
I have many regrets about the new friend thing!

author: unknow
sentence: Ninety eight, ninety nine, one hundred! Ready or not, here I come!

author: girl
sentence: Oh! There you are, Wolf! I win again! Woo hoo!

author: girl
sentence: That's four thousand three hundred and ninety six for me. And for you, zero.

author: wolf
sentence: WOLF WAS DISTRACTED! LET WOLF PLAY AGAIN, HE WILL WIN THIS TIME.

author: girl
sentence: Maaaybe. Y'know, if you stop growling so much it'll take me longer to find you. Then you can finally beat me!

author: wolf
sentence: WOLF WILL PRACTICE NOT GROWLING. HE WILL BE THE QUIETEST WOLF.

author: girl
sentence: Hooray! And look, you found a human! Hello, human!

author: girl
sentence: What are you doing in the spirit realm? You've very pale and shaky for human.
responses: Er, hello! Is this wolf your... friend?
I think that wolf wants to eat me.
Please tell your wolf friend to close his mouth.

author: girl
sentence: Not exactly my friend. Although we are friendly!

author: wolf
sentence: WOLF IS VERY FRIENDLY, YES HE IS.

author: girl
sentence: In a way, we're the same. But in another way, we're completely different!

author: girl
sentence: He's realy bad at hide-and-seek.

author: girl
sentence: Don't worry. Wolf only bites spirits. Bad spirits.

author: wolf
sentence: WOLF BITES PEOPLE TOO. ITS FUN FOR HIM.

author: girl
sentence: Wolf, not right now. You're scaring the human!

author: wolf
sentence: OOPS. WOLF IS SORRY.

author: girl
sentence: Wolf, you need to be polite around new friends!

author: wolf
sentence: WOLF WILL CLOSE HIS MOUTH WOLF APOLOGIZES, YES HE DOES.

author: girl
sentence: Sorry about that. Wolf is always hungry, you see. So his mouth is always open!

author: wolf
sentence: LIKE THIS!

author: girl
sentence: You know, I'm getting kind of bored of winning hide-and-seek so much.

author: girl
sentence: Would you play with me, non-spirit?
responses: I love playing games with children and thier monster friends in strange forest!
Only if Wolf promises not to eat me.
I will destroy you at hide-and-seek, little girl.

author: wolf
sentence: WOLF DOESN'T THINK YOU CAN WIN. HIDE-AND-SEEK IS VERY HARD.

author: girl
sentence: I'm sure you're better hider than Wolf, right? I bet you'd know not to growl when you're hidding! Right? Right?

author: girl
sentence: Okay, I'll start counting! One, two, three...
[You walk away as silently as possible to search for creative hidding spot.]
[... But what is a little girl doing all the way out here?]
